task_summary: The robot must reach a towel laid out on a work area by perceiving its location and moving the end-effector to contact or align with the towel.

task_long_description.overview: This episode documents a bimanual robot (xArm) tasked to reach a towel placed onto an artificial grass mat on a table. The robots begin from rest, perceive the working space for the towel, and maneuver towards the towel's surface in a visually guided fashion, halting upon either light contact or alignment. Core constraints are visibility of the towel and accurate approach. Robustness is needed for perception and motion, but no grasp or manipulation is performed after contact.
preconditions: Robot arms are initialized and untangled.
Workspace is unobstructed with the towel laid flat.
Towel is visible under workspace lighting.
stepwise_plan: Move end-effector to align or make contact with the towel.
success_criteria: End-effector in close proximity to or touching the towel.
No collision with workspace borders or other objects.
Successful perception of the towel coordinates.
failure_and_recovery: Failure to perceive towel: retry scan up to three times.
Approach error: realign if destination missed.
Robot arm contact with non-towel surface: abort or retry.
task_long_description.termination: Tree completes once the robot reaches and aligns with the towel (IsAt condition satisfied).

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks whether the towel is visible in the workspace.
Retries scanning for the towel in the workspace using a grid pattern.
Detects the precise position of the towel once visible.
Moves end-effector towards towel, aligning with a tight tolerance.
Verifies that the robot is at the towel (final goal state).

recovery_strategy: Retry scanning for towel up to 3 times.
Adjust and re-approach if not at the target.
assumptions: Instruction requests only 'reach' not 'grasp', so no gripper closure or grasp in tree.
Frames unambiguously support a reach and align behavior; no manipulation past contact.
Timeouts, force, and tolerance omitted in instruction, defaulted by best practice.
Only one towel present and always reachable.
Dual arm robot but only one arm appears active.

expected_success_criteria: End-effector positioned above or touching towel.
No damage or disturbance to workspace.
Scan retries used only if perception fails.
